posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Ok, first things first.


Yes, you can take Dragon Shape in a level 30 environment. In fact you can have Dragon Shape by level 28 which is the earliest possible by taking 20 Druid levels pre-epic, then 4 CoT levels then 4 additional Druid levels and select the feat as your bonus Druid 24th level bonus feat. Additionally you will be undispellable by anything else than Mord's with 24 Druid levels and have a full spellbook and good DC's for your spells.

Is it one dimensional? No, i do not think so because you will have also all druid spells available and some of them like Ice storm and Firestorm don't have a cap so they are worth casting and especially empowered. Also do not forget that you can also take wisdom based archery and hit things with a longbow too.

What are the best possible spreads for a character like that? The best possible spread would be either Druid 30 (RP focussed), or Druid 20/ CoT 4/ Monk 6 (power Build), as they have been explained by the Master of Dragons himself here.

druid-monk-dragon-shape-lvl-30-t515537.html

Is that Druid in need of Penentration feats? Depends on what your enemies are. If you have Drow there for example then you definitely need at least greater spell penentration.

What are the best schools to focus? Druids leave and die by the name of Conjuration and Evocation is usually their second best due to Firestorm for the most part. Druids are the only one class that can empower the firestorm spell in order to do (in your case) 45d6 AoE damage with a single casting. But, i have found that actually if you have good wisdom, Necromany is very good too. Mainly the Finger of Death spell can shut down powerful enemies in a blink of an eye. Depends if the fortitude saves of your enemies are very high or normal in your world. From these three schools, Conjuration is the standard choice that you just can't go wrong (stonehold - storm of vengeance).


All these are nice and well, though you haven't tell us your environment and what restrictions if any are there. Usually most PW's restrict heavily the Dragon Shape or at least try to provide counter measures for that. If your world has them unrestricted or even close to that, then a Druid/Dragon is from the most overpowered builds you can make, just the constant true seeing and the damage reduction of 40/+6 are enough.

I hope that i helped.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Well, as per regular NWN you can get Dragon Shape before 30th level, but it does require great sacrifice. Staying near-pure druid, though, may not be such a great idea. Dragon Shape requires 30 Wisdom, which as you can imagine takes up A LOT OF Great Wisdom feats to be attained before 30th level, which in turn basically are very hard to have without Bonus Feats from another class. The class that has Great Wisdom as an option is Champion of Torm, which is commonly seen in combination with Druid in Dragon Shape builds. I'm not even sure you can reach it without bonus feats. You can start with 18 Wisdom, with 7 stat increases you'll get up to 25. You have 21, 24, 27 and 30 as your regular epic feats, which brings the total out to 29, still 1 point short. Technically, if you have 28 Druid levels, you'll get 2 Bonus feats, one for a Great Wisdom and another one for Dragon Shape, but then you would have NO EPIC FEATS for anything else AND you'd only have DS at 30th level.

So you can do this two ways: Druid 28 / Monk 2 and have Dragon Shape at level 30 or you can give you your casting prowess (only in terms of caster levels) and go Druid 18 Monk 2 CoT 10 with 4 CoT pre-epic to grant full attack schedule. You could base yourself up on this build:

Champion of the Wilderness

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Many many thoughts. LOL

1- get some Monk in there! Druids get bonus feats every 4 levels after 20,, so 24 and 28. Druid 30 and Druid 28 are VIRTUALLY THE SAME (you lose just 2 Caster levels, which isn't bad at all).

2- You don't need to invest in physical stats with a Druid because you'll either fight ranged through Zen Archery or melee shifting, which overrides all physical stats. You don't have Power Attack, so why 13 STR? Why 13 CON? Start with 8 in all Con Dex and Str and 18 Wisdom. I recommend you read THIS GUIDE to understand the class a little better. There are playstyle tips and in-depth explanation of class features in there. Worth your time, definitely! You shouldn't be fighting in the front lines with a Druid. You should hang back while your summons, animal companions and even an eventual animal charmed with Animal Empathy do your killing for you while you cast the occasional spell or shoot the occasional arrow.

After you're done reading the guide, hopefully you can take another look at your build and be able to make some adjustments. I'll wait till then before I say more. You'll learn more if you go through the mental journey yourself than if we just tell you stuff.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
The thing with the correctly build Druids is that they can be what you want (strong spellcaster) AND get Dragon Shape. It is only one feat for them and you naturally want to go for highest wisdom anyway. With Druid 28/ Monk 2 as Max said, you will be able to take Dragon Shape as your capstone feat and have the awesome synergy Monk gives to the build. And Monk also has discipline as a class skill if you want to invest on that. In other words it is a win/win situation.

If i understood well, with your sub-race adjustments you will be able to take Dragon shape, have a natural wisdom of thirty at the end take also ESF in conjuration, all at the same time. You need to start with 18 (19) wisdom though and get rid of the useless epic spells that do nothing except steal you precious epic feats from you.

Just for comparison: HEllball does 40 d6 damage and your empowered firestorm does 45 d6 at the same level with higher DC as well.. Really the only epic spells that are worth it are EMA & Warding and those are for mages.

Also read the guide by Max, it is very helpful so to understand Druid's powers.

Much better man, much better but one thing only.

Do whatever you want with the secon non-druid level but let the Monk 1 in at least. You seriously do not want to loose all those super-buffs from Monk by taking Ranger or whatever else.

Ranger was there to max discipline? If yes, Monk can do that too, he has it as a class skill too. To give you an example of what's going on imagine that at level 30 with maxed Wisdom one level of Monk will give you a freaking +16 AC! It does more than that too, it will max your discipline, give you Cleave without the need of power attack, give you 2 more attacks to all your shapes (including the Dragon) and evasion!! All that with one level, so dont leave it out of the build.

posts.author: Tyris2222
posts.content:
Followed up with your monk suggestions and found this.

Monk AC Bonus
The AC bonus is capped to Monk level (e.g. a level 3 Monk would only receive a maximum of +3 AC from their Monk AC Bonus, no matter how high their Wisdom modifier is).

Additionally, this feat is not given until level 3 Monk, and will not function while polymorphed.

So I'm thinking that 3 levels of monk just won't be doable and still get dragonshape and regardless of the three won't be helping when shifted so it seems that its the best can do under the circumstances.

Yeah, in this case, I'd say half the usefulness of Monk is gimped, but if the attack progression still works, it might still be better than 1d6 SA. Rogue doesn't give AC either, just 1d6 SA and UMD (but you can't use items while polymorphed, so half the usefulness of UMD is lost). If Monk gives you 2 extra attacks per round (Monks gain an extra attack every 3 BAB points gained before 20, not every 5 like everyone else, so they can reach 6 attacks per round, plus 1 Hasted and plus another one with the Flurry of Blows mode activated for a maximum total of 8 attacks per round in DS, whereas a regular Druid would get 5 with 16+ pre-epic BAB), evasion and Cleave, it's still better to take Monk over Rogue IMO. Find out if the attack schedule works while polymorphed and if it does, it's still worth taking the level. Otherwise, Rogue is better!
